1. Start your day with a few minutes of mindfulness: Begin your day with a few minutes of mindful breathing, meditation, or a prayer. This will help you to set a positive tone and help you to focus on the present moment.

2. Take breaks during the day: Take a few minutes to breathe, relax, and switch off your mind from work. Go for a walk outside or take a yoga break during your lunch break.

3. Practice mindful eating: Take time to notice your food, savor the flavors, and enjoy the textures. This will help you to become more present, and also ensure that you are eating mindfully and healthily.

4. Practice mindful breathing: Whenever you feel stressed or anxious, take a few deep breaths and focus on your breath. This will help you to calm down, focus, and refocus.

5. Use technology wisely: There are many apps and websites that promote mindfulness and relaxation. Try using these to help you practice mindfulness every day. 

6. Prioritize self-care: Make time for activites that promote relaxation and wellbeing such as taking hot baths, going for a relaxing massage or stretching. 

7. Cultivate an attitude of mindfulness: As you go about your daily activities and tasks, try to keep your attention on the present moment. By cultivating an attitude of mindfulness in everything you do, you'll be more mindful and present in your life.
